org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.expr
Interface IAeExpressionRunner

All Known Implementing Classes:
AeAbstractExpressionRunner
public interface IAeExpressionRunner

This interface should be implemented in order to provide an implementation of an expression runner. An expression runner is capable of executing an expression in a particular expression language. Examples of expression runners would be XPath and XQuery expression runners. By default, BPEL 1.0 compliant engines must be able to execute XPath 1.0 expressions, so there will be at least one implementation of this interface (for XPath 1.0 expressions). Note that, currently, a new instance of an expression runner will be created every time one is needed. So at the moment, expression runners do not need to be thread safe, since they will not be reused.

Method Detail

executeExpression

public java.lang.Object executeExpression(IAeExpressionRunnerContext aContext,
                                          java.lang.String aExpression)
                                   throws AeException
This method is called to execute an expression. The result of an expression will be some sort of object. The result could be a Boolean, a List, a Document, etc...

Parameters:
aContext - The expression execution context
aExpression - The expression to execute.
Throws:
AeException

executeBooleanExpression

public java.lang.Boolean executeBooleanExpression(IAeExpressionRunnerContext aContext,
                                                  java.lang.String aExpression)
                                           throws AeException
Executes a boolean expression. A boolean expression is simply an expression evaluates to a boolean.

Parameters:
aContext - The expression execution context
aExpression - The expression to execute.
Throws:
AeException

executeDeadlineExpression

public java.util.Date executeDeadlineExpression(IAeExpressionRunnerContext aContext,
                                                java.lang.String aExpression)
                                         throws AeException
Executes a deadline expression. A deadline expression is an expression that evaluates to a BPEL deadline. A BPEL deadline is defined as a xml schema 'date' or 'dateTime' type.

Parameters:
aContext - The expression execution context
aExpression - The expression to execute.
Throws:
AeException

executeDurationExpression

public AeSchemaDuration executeDurationExpression(IAeExpressionRunnerContext aContext,
                                                  java.lang.String aExpression)
                                           throws AeException
Executes a duration expression. A duration expression is an expression that evaluates to a BPEL duration. A BPEL duration is defined as the xml schema type 'duration'. See the xml schema specification for more details on how to format a duration.

Parameters:
aContext - The expression execution context
aExpression - The expression to execute.
Throws:
AeException

executeJoinConditionExpression

public java.lang.Boolean executeJoinConditionExpression(IAeExpressionRunnerContext aContext,
                                                        java.lang.String aExpression)
                                                 throws AeException
Executes a join condition expression. A join condition expression is an expression that evaluates to a boolean and conforms to some restrictions that are outlined in the specification.

Parameters:
aContext - The expression execution context
aExpression - The expression to execute.
Throws:
AeException
